services.details: Regular Brushing: Brush your dog’s coat at least once a week to prevent matting and reduce shedding. The type of brush varies based on coat type (slicker brushes for curly coats, bristle brushes for short-haired breeds).
Bathing Schedule: Bathe your dog every 4-6 weeks, depending on activity level and coat type. Use dog-specific shampoo to avoid skin irritation.
Nail Trimming: Trim nails every 3-4 weeks. Keep the clippers sharp, and avoid the quick (the pinkish area with nerves and blood vessels) to prevent pain.
Ear Cleaning: Check ears weekly for signs of wax buildup or infection. Use a vet-approved ear cleaner, and gently wipe only the visible parts of the ear.
Regular Walks: Aim for at least one walk a day to keep your dog active and stimulated. Adjust the length and intensity based on their breed, age, and energy level.
Hiking Adventures: Many dogs love hiking trails. Start with easy trails, bring plenty of water, and watch for signs of fatigue, especially in hot weather.
etch & Frisbee: Playing fetch or Frisbee is a great way for high-energy dogs to burn off steam. A spacious park or beach is ideal, but make sure it’s a safe, off-leash-friendly area.

Agility Course: Set up a simple agility course in your backyard or visit a local dog park with one. Use items like cones, tunnels, and jumps to create an obstacle course. It’s a fun way to build your dog's agility and strengthen your bond through training.
